title: Joan, I'm Disappearing
lyrics:
It turned to shit
On April 18th
At home on the stairs
With an old cup of tea and your head
Held heavy in your hands

All the trouble with your sleeping

From a hole I could hear your breathing

Restless under blinding lights



A fool, I fenced our love into a rock

And I have no defense

For how we go a-bed

I should have begged for you to stay



Joan I've loved you since I

Was seventeen

And I am lost without you

At first I didn't feel it

But now I'm disappearing



I'll sit here for days

In my every different hate

Given the year

It's unlikely I'll ever change



But you were right

I fenced our love into a rock

And I have no defense

For how we go a-bed



I should have begged for you to stay



Joan I've loved you since I

Was seventeen

And I am lost without you

At first I didn't feel it

But now I'm disappearing



I'm disappearing

I'm disappearing

I'm disappearing
